Cannot download - Download folder not found. Use app settings to select one

Cannot download - Stale Cookies or credentials. Use the notification to regenerate them

Automatically refresh library data by rescanning files and folders.
Rename all folders according to the current naming and max length preference
Remove placeholder books imported through metadata
Exporting metadata is meant to create a list of your books in JSON format.\nIt is not meant for moving your collection to your PC or your SD card.\nTap here to learn how to do that.
Books are exported without images.\nYou will have to download them again upon restore if the images folder is not present.
You must grant permissions before you can continue
You must manually grant permissions before you can continue

Be aware that downloads may fail on this site.
The download button is currently broken for this site.
This site currently has serious stability issues. The app has nothing to do about it. Please try again later.
This site is currently unavailable for real. The app has nothing to do about it. Please try again later.
The Hentoid dev team is working on a fix. You will be notified by the app when a new version is ready.
A fix is available on the latest version of the app. Please update.
App Lock prevents unauthorized use of this app by requiring a 4-digit PIN when launched
Hentoid is a Doujinshi & H-Manga archiving app. Hentoid was originally created by Cesar Arasaki.
PERSONAL DATA PRIVACY STATEMENT\n\nHentoid is a free and open-source software maintained by the Hentoid Community (join us on Discord - see link above)
Hentoid collects the following personal data and sends them to Google for processing through the firebase library:\n - Session ID\n - IP address

The abovementioned data is removed from Firebase live and backup system within 180 days (see https://firebase.google.com/support/privacy/ for more details)\n\nNo other personal data is collected nor sent to any other party.

At least one book failed to be deleted
WebView is not installed or disabled

Hentoid has been unable to find Android's built-in Web Viewer for apps.
Without it you can't browse sources, redownload books; you really can't do much that requires Internet.

It is most likely that it's actually installed on your system, but disabled: please go to Settings > Apps > Disabled apps and enable Android System WebView.

If you can't find the app, please install it from your device's App Store.
